FAQ.question: What is Karnataka RTC (Pahani) for Agriculture?
FAQ.answer: RTC (Record of Rights, Tenancy & Crops), also called Pahani, is an official land record showing ownership, land extent, cultivation details, crop information, and liabilities for agricultural land in Karnataka.

FAQ.question: Why is the RTC/Pahani important?
FAQ.answer: It is required for crop loans, subsidies, land disputes, buying/selling agriculture land, mutation updates, and verification of ownership and cultivation status.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to get the RTC?
FAQ.answer: You must provide the district, taluk, hobli, village, survey number, and sub-division number (if applicable).

FAQ.question: How long does it take to obtain the RTC?
FAQ.answer: If the record exists digitally on Bhoomi, it is available instantly; otherwise, it may take 1â€“2 working days depending on backend verification.

FAQ.question: What information does the RTC contain?
FAQ.answer: It includes owner name, survey number, land extent, soil type, crops grown, tenancy details, water source, and any government or bank liabilities on the land.
